awd_abstract_narration: Numerical calculations of the structure and evolution of stars                  require a solid understanding of the hydrodynamic differential                  equations that underlie all gas dynamical processes.  They also                 require knowledge of numerous additional physical processes, such               as nuclear reactions, stellar opacities, and equations of state.                The Principal Investigator proposes to focus on the latter two                  processes (Project 1).  Furthermore, he will carry out numerical                computations of stellar envelope pulsations using a nonlinear                   radiation hydrodynamics code (Project 2).                                                                                                                       Project 1 is designed to improve and to resolve present                         uncertainies in the opacity and equations of state tables used in               stellar atmosphere studies.  Success in this task is of crucial                 importance to Project 2, which will focus on stellar envelope                   pulsations, such as those observed in RR Lyrae and Cepheid stars.                                                                                               The work will be done in collaboration with large atomic physics                groups at the University College London and Queen's University                  Belfast, and with colleagues in the US, France, Germany, and                    Venezuela.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
